newsitem.title: USA: MOZELLE THOMPSON SEEN GETTING CLINTON FTC NOD -WSJ.
newsitem.headline: MOZELLE THOMPSON SEEN GETTING CLINTON FTC NOD -WSJ.

text.p: The Clinton Administration is expected to nominate Treasury official Mozelle Thompson to fill a vacant seat at the Federal Trade Commission, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing government officials.
Thompson, 42, gained a reputation for aggressive enforcement of federal antitrust and consumer-protection laws while a lawyer at the New York firm Skadden, Arps in the 1980s, the paper said.

If confirmed, Thompson would be the first black commissioner to serve on the FTC since 1964, the paper said. He would succeed Christine Varney, who resigned to start an Internet-law practice, the paper added.
